intro: Byttneria ekmanii, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The tree produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, flat seeds. It is often found in moist woodland and swampy areas, where it can grow up to 30 meters tall. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing it with some resistance to pests and diseases.
